entity1.name: Deja Vu
entity1.description: A mysterious and fascinating phenomenon that gives a person the feeling of having experienced or seen something before.;;;A phenomenon where a person has a strong feeling that they have experienced a situation before, despite knowing that it is their first time encountering it.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that an event or experience currently being experienced has been experienced in the past.;;;A term of French origin meaning 'already seen,' which refers to the feeling or sensation that one has experienced a current situation before, even though it is actually happening for the first time.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is not actually the case.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before.;;;A phenomenon where a person has the feeling that an event or experience currently being experienced has been experienced in the past.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is actually their first time.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is their first time.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is their first time encountering it.;;;A phenomenon where a person has a strong feeling that a current event or experience has happened before, despite knowing it is not actually the case.;;;A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed a current situation before, often described as a feeling of familiarity.
entity1.chunkid: The Science of Deja Vu20;;;The Science of Deja Vu3;;;The Science of Deja Vu12;;;The Science of Deja Vu18;;;The Science of Deja Vu2;;;The Science of Deja Vu16;;;The Science of Deja Vu7;;;The Science of Deja Vu17;;;The Science of Deja Vu8;;;The Science of Deja Vu1;;;The Science of Deja Vu10;;;The Science of Deja Vu4;;;The Science of Deja Vu13

entity2.name: scientists
entity2.description: Individuals who are engaged in systematic investigation to discover and interpret new knowledge or to revise existing knowledge based on the science of deja vu.;;;Experts in various fields of science who conduct research to expand knowledge and understanding.
entity2.chunkid: The Science of Deja Vu1;;;The Science of Deja Vu16

entity3.name: psychologists
entity3.description: Experts in the field of psychology who study human behavior and mental processes.

entity4.name: general public
entity4.description: The broad population or community, not limited to any specific profession or expertise.;;;The ordinary people, not specifically involved in research, who are interested in and influenced by the phenomenon of deja vu.
entity4.chunkid: The Science of Deja Vu1;;;The Science of Deja Vu16

entity6.name: French
entity6.description: The language of France, from which the term 'deja vu' originates.

entity9.name: dual processing theory
entity9.description: A hypothesis suggesting that deja vu occurs when the brain processes information in two different ways simultaneously.

entity11.name: memory-based theory
entity11.description: A theoretical explanation for deja vu, suggesting that it is caused by similarities between the present scenario and a past memory.

entity12.name: brain
entity12.description: The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing information and controlling bodily functions.;;;The central organ of the human nervous system, located in the skull and responsible for controlling most bodily activities.
entity12.chunkid: The Science of Deja Vu8;;;The Science of Deja Vu20

entity14.name: stress
entity14.description: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or demanding circumstances.

entity15.name: fatigue
entity15.description: The condition of not having enough sleep, often leading to impaired cognitive and physiological functions.;;;Extreme tiredness, typically resulting from mental or physical exertion or illness.

entity26.name: consciousness
entity26.description: The state of being aware of one's surroundings and thoughts, often studied in philosophy and psychology.
